Yes, here are a few additional tips to keep your leather jacket looking great:

1. Keep it clean: Regularly dust off your jacket with a soft, dry cloth to prevent dirt and debris from building up. Avoid using water or harsh chemicals to clean your jacket, as this can damage the leather.

2. Avoid extreme temperatures: Heat and humidity can damage leather, so avoid storing your jacket in direct sunlight or damp areas. Don't expose your jacket to extreme heat, such as a radiator or fireplace.

3. Hang your jacket properly: To avoid creases or wrinkles, hang your jacket on a sturdy hanger in a well-ventilated closet. Avoid using wire hangers, as they can leave marks on leather.

4. Use a leather protector: Consider using a leather protector spray or cream to help repel water, dirt, and stains. Follow the instructions on the label and test on a small area first.

5. Wear it often: Leather jackets are meant to be worn and will develop a unique patina over time with regular use. Don't be afraid to wear your jacket often!

By following these tips, you can help to keep your leather jacket in great condition and looking sharp for years to come.
